. üá´üá∑ Le vendredi c‚Äôest #LaModeAuLouvre !

üé® Ce magnifique portrait en pied a √©t√© r√©alis√© vers 1761 par le peintre anglais Thomas Gainsborough. Il repr√©sente Lady Alston les bras crois√©s et la t√™te l√©g√®rement tourn√©e sur le c√¥t√©.
-
üëó Elle est v√™tue d'une somptueuse robe de satin. Les dentelles noires de son ch√¢le viennent r√©pondre aux dentelles blanches de ses manches, appel√©es "engageantes". Ces diff√©rents tissus permettent au peintre de montrer toute sa virtuosit√©.
-
üîé Avec ce tableau, Gainsborough chercher √† s‚Äôattirer une client√®le aristocratique. Il a par ailleurs √©t√© peint √† Bath, c√©l√®bre ville d‚Äôeau anglaise tr√®s fr√©quent√©e au XVIIIe si√®cle.

üåç It‚Äôs #FashionFriday at the Louvre!

üé® This magnificent full-length portrait was painted circa 1761 by the English painter Thomas Gainsborough. He depicted Lady Alston with her arms folded and her head slightly turned to the side.
-
üëó She is dressed in a sumptuous satin dress. The black lace of her shawl is matched with the white lace of her ruffle sleeves. With these different fabrics, the painter shows his virtuosity.
-
üîé With this work, Gainsborough aimed to attract an aristocratic clientele. He painted it in the famous English spa town Bath, which was very popular in the 18th century.
-
üì∑ ¬© RMN - Grand Palais (Mus√©e du Louvre) / Jean-Gilles Berizzi

üá´üá∑ Pour les f√™tes, nous vous invitons √† d√©jeuner ! ‚§µÔ∏è
-
üßÄ Sur une table couverte d'une nappe, tr√¥ne dans un plat d‚Äô√©tain un jambon entam√©, accompagn√© √† sa droite d‚Äôune pyramide de fromages et √† gauche, d‚Äôune assiette de fa√Øence bleue bien garnie. Sur le devant, diff√©rents pains et un couteau. A l‚Äôarri√®re-plan, se devinent un verre √† boire, un pichet de fa√Øence grise et un pot d'√©tain.
-
üîé Cette ¬´¬†Nature morte au jambon¬†¬ª de Floris van Schooten est appel√©e dans la tradition nordique "ontbijtje", terme signifiant nature morte de petit-d√©jeuner, ou repas l√©ger que l‚Äôon peut prendre √† toute heure du jour. L‚Äôoeuvre ob√©it aux principes esth√©tiques et aux r√®gles de pr√©sentation en vigueur √† l'√©poque pour ce genre de peinture.
-
üëÄ La table, en perspective frontale et strictement parall√®le au cadre du tableau, est recouverte d‚Äôune nappe et le point de vue de l‚Äôobservateur sur les objets bien s√©par√©s les uns des autres, est sur√©lev√© permettant ainsi une vue d‚Äôensemble des denr√©es en train visiblement d‚Äô√™tre consomm√©es.
- - -
üåé For holidays, we invite you to lunch! ‚§µÔ∏è
-
üßÄ A pewter dish sits in the center of a table covered with a cloth marked by sharply-creased folds. A cut ham sits in the dish, next to an impressive pile of three of cheeses and, to the left, a blue ceramic plate loaded with food. In the foreground are different breads and a knife. In the background, a drinking-glass, a grey earthenware jug, and a pewter pot may be seen.
-
üîé Known in the northern European tradition as an "ontbitje" (meaning a still-life depicting a breakfast, or a light meal to be taken at any time of day) this ¬´¬†still-life with ham¬†¬ª by Floris van Schooten followed a stringent set of aesthetic principles and compositional rules.
-
üëÄ The table, shown from the front and aligned with the bottom edge of the picture space, is covered with a cloth. The viewer looks down onto the objects arranged on the tabletop, and these are usually spread out, and clearly separated from one another. The picture presents an overall view of the foodstuffs, which are seemingly in the process of being eaten.‚Ä®-
üì∑ ¬© RMN - Grand Palais / Franck Raux

üåü ¬´ L‚ÄôAdoration des Bergers ¬ª a √©t√© r√©alis√© par Georges de La Tour en 1644. Le tableau est baign√© dans un doux clair-obscur, gr√¢ce √† la flamme de la bougie tenue par Joseph.

üåü ‚ÄúThe Adoration of the Shepherds‚Äù was made by Georges de La Tour in 1644. The painter invites you to gaze at an intimate scene depicting the shepherds, who came to gather around the Christ Child. This work is bathed in a light chiaroscuro, thanks to the flame of the candle held by Joseph.

üá´üá∑ Vendredi c‚Äôest #LaModeAuLouvre ! Aujourd‚Äôhui focus sur la coiffure de l‚ÄôApollon Cithar√®de. ‚§µÔ∏è
-
üëÄ Objet de notre campagne #TousM√©c√®nes, ce bronze exceptionnel rescap√© du V√©suve repr√©sente Apollon. Sa coiffure sophistiqu√©e associ√©e √† la nudit√© est l‚Äôun des indices qui permettent d‚Äôidentifier cette figure juv√©nile masculine comme √©tant le dieu grec des arts.
-
üîé Les m√®ches √©paisses, r√©parties de part et d‚Äôautre d‚Äôune raie m√©diane, sont relev√©es au-dessus des tempes puis gliss√©es sous le bandeau qui ceint la t√™te, avant de s‚Äôenrouler pour former un chignon, appel√© crobylos. Deux m√®ches boucl√©es √©chappent √† cet agencement raffin√© pour retomber sur les √©paules de chaque c√¥t√© du cou ; d‚Äôautres, plus fines, se r√©partissent sur le front et √† la naissance de la nuque.
-
‚úçÔ∏è La plasticit√© des m√®ches et la profondeur des sillons qui parcourent la chevelure t√©moignent de l‚Äôimportance du travail pr√©paratoire r√©alis√© par le sculpteur qui a con√ßu l‚Äô≈ìuvre, d‚Äôabord en argile puis sur le mod√®le interm√©diaire en cire avant la coul√©e.
-
üåé It‚Äôs #FashionFriday at the Louvre! Today, focus on the Apollo Kitharoidos hairstyle. ‚§µÔ∏è
-
üëÄ Subject of our ‚ÄúBecome a patron‚Äù campaign, this exceptional bronze depicts Apollo. His sophisticated hairstyle and nudity is one clue to allow us to identify this young male figure as the Greek god of the arts.
-
üîé The thick locks distributed on either side of a central parting are bound up over the temples with a headband and rolled into a bun called crobylos. Two curled locks of hair escape from this refined arrangement and fall onto the shoulders on either side of the neck; other, finer, locks are spread across the forehead and at the nape of the neck.
-
‚úçÔ∏è The sculptural quality of the locks and the deep grooves running through the hair show the extent of the preparatory work carried out by the sculptor, first in clay and then in wax, before he began casting.
-
üì∑ ¬© Mus√©e du Louvre / Ma√´lys Feunteun

üá´üá∑ Le Louvre vient d‚Äôacqu√©rir L‚Äô√âl√®ve int√©ressante par Marguerite G√©rard (1761-1837) !
-
‚úçÔ∏è Marguerite G√©rard est l‚Äôune des femmes artistes les plus importantes de la fin du XVIIIe si√®cle, reconnue pour ses sc√®nes de genre et ses petits portraits. Elle est d√©sormais repr√©sent√©e dans les collections du Louvre par une oeuvre majeure, aux c√¥t√©s de la brillante g√©n√©ration de femmes artistes de son √©poque, Ad√©la√Øde Labille-Guiard, Anne Vallayer-Coster et Elisabeth Vig√©e Le Brun.
-
üîé Ce tableau est l‚Äôune des premi√®res peintures pr√©sent√©es sous le seul nom de Marguerite G√©rard, m√™me s‚Äôil n‚Äôest pas impossible que Fragonard ait peint quelques d√©tails comme le chat et le chien en bas √† droite. L‚Äôoeuvre offre d‚Äôailleurs un hommage au peintre : la figure principale √©tudie une gravure d‚Äôune composition de Fragonard, ¬´ La Fontaine d‚Äôamour ¬ª (@gettymuseum).
-
üëÄ L‚Äô√âl√®ve int√©ressante offre une composition raffin√©e. La d√©licatesse du traitement des tissus, le rendu des mati√®res, le poli des m√©taux et le subtil clair-obscur sont exceptionnels.
- - - -
üåé The Louvre has just acquired ‚ÄúL‚Äô√©l√®ve int√©ressante‚Äù by Marguerite G√©rard (1761-1837)!
-
‚úçÔ∏è Marguerite G√©rard is one of the most important women artists of the late 18th century, known for her genre scenes and small portraits. She is now represented in the Louvre by a major work, next to the brilliant generation of women artists of her time, with Ad√©la√Øde Labille-Guiard, Anne Vallayer-Coster and Elisabeth Vig√©e Le Brun.
-
üîé This painting is one of the first paintings presented under the sole name of Marguerite G√©rard, although it is possible that Fragonard painted some details such as the cat and the dog in the lower right. This work also offers a tribute to the painter: the main figure studies an engraving of a Fragonard's composition, "La Fontaine d'amour"
(@gettymuseum).
-
üëÄ ‚ÄúL‚Äô√©l√®ve int√©ressante‚Äù offers a refined composition. The delicate treatment of the fabrics, the rendering of the materials, the polish of the metals and the subtle chiaroscuro are exceptional.
-

üá´üá∑ Mercredi, c‚Äôest #HistoireDuLouvre ! Aujourdhui, focus la cour du Sphinx. ‚§µÔ∏è
-
üåø Nous vous parlions la semaine derni√®re de la mosa√Øque des Saisons fra√Æchement restaur√©e. Le saviez-vous ? Cette mosa√Øque est expos√©e dans la cour du Sphinx depuis son arriv√©e en France en 1935 !
-
üëë √âdifi√©e en 1663 par Le Vau, cette petite cour (√† l'origine, dite "de la reine") √©tait encadr√©e √† l'est par une aile nouvelle orn√©e d'un fronton, au sud par la Grande Galerie et au nord par une salle de spectacle.
-
üëÄ Ferm√©e √† l'ouest par Hector Lefuel entre 1855 et 1857, elle ne sera couverte d'une verri√®re qu'en 1934 pour prot√©ger les monuments antiques grecs et romains qui s'y trouvent pr√©sent√©s, dont la mosa√Øque des Saisons en son centre.
- - - -
üåé Wednesday it‚Äôs #LouvreHistory! Today, focus on the Sphinx yard. ‚§µÔ∏è
-
üåø We told you last week about the recently restored Seasons mosaic. Did you know? This mosaic is presented in the Sphinx yard since its arrival in France in 1935!
-
üëë Built in 1663 by Le Vau, this small court (originally known as the "Queen's Court") was bordered to the east by a new wing featuring a pediment, to the south by the Grande Galerie and to the north by a theater.
-
üëÄ The western side was closed off between 1855 and 1857 by Hector Lefuel, but it was not until 1934 that a glass roof was installed to protect the ancient Greek and Roman monuments displayed there. In the center is the magnificent Seasons mosaic.
-
üì∑ ¬© 2015 Mus√©e du Louvre / Antoine Mongodin / Marianne Fromencourt

üá´üá∑ Nous vous souhaitons une #BonneSemaine avec le Verrou de Jean-Honor√© Fragonard !

üóù Simple sc√®ne de genre dans l‚Äôesprit grivois de l‚Äô√©poque du roi Louis XV (1715-1774) ou tableau d‚Äôhistoire moralisant ? Le tableau repr√©sente l‚Äôamour profane, oppos√© √† l‚Äôamour sacr√© de son pendant. Sa facture lisse et l‚Äôusage d‚Äôun puissant clair-obscur marquent un tournant dans le style de Fragonard.
-
üëÉDans le cadre de la collaboration entre le Louvre et @officine_universelle_buly, la parfumeuse Delphine Lebeau s‚Äôest inspir√©e de ce chef-d‚Äô≈ìuvre pour imaginer une fragrance sensuelle aux notes de fleur de lys triomphante sur lit imp√©rial musqu√©. üåé We wish you a #GoodWeek with The Lock of Fragonard!

üóù Is it a simple genre scene in the libertine spirit of King Louis XV‚Äôs reign (1715-1774), or a moralistic tale? The painting itself shows profane love, as opposed to its counterpart, sacred love. Its smooth finish, along with the use of a powerful chiaroscuro, illustrate a dramatic change in Fragonard‚Äôs style.
-
üëÉ As part of the collaboration between the Louvre and @officine_universelle_buly, the French perfumer Delphine Lebeau was inspired by this masterpiece to create a bewitching perfume with white lily flower and musc. To be discovered in the Louvre‚Äôs pop-up store, in the ‚Äúall√©e du Grand Louvre‚Äù, under the Pyramid.

‚ú® ‚Ä™A l‚Äôoccasion de l‚Äôexposition L√©onard de Vinci, la marque de pr√™t-√†-porter Off-White lance une collection capsule c√©l√©brant la vie et l‚Äô≈ìuvre de cet artiste visionnaire.

‚ú® In commemoration of the ‚ÄúLeonardo da Vinci‚Äù exhibition, the ready-to-wear brand releases a capsule of clothing items celebrating the life and works of the visionary artist.

üëÄ The capsule imagery was shot inside the Grande Galerie of the Louvre, capturing the immense history celebrated within France‚Äôs national museum, while truly connecting this modern collection with its core inspiration, as the Louvre holds the largest collection in the world of da Vinci‚Äôs paintings, alongside 22 drawings.

üá´üá∑ Reconnaissez-vous ce portrait ?
-
üëë Fils a√Æn√© du roi des Fran√ßais Louis-Philippe Ier, et promis √† sa succession, le duc d'Orl√©ans √©tait une figure tr√®s populaire. Ami des romantiques, il fut aussi celui du peintre fran√ßais Jean-Auguste-‚Ä™Dominique Ingres‚Ä¨, qui ex√©cuta ce portrait en 1842, deux mois avant la mort pr√©matur√©e du duc lors d‚Äôun accident de cal√®che √† seulement 32 ans.
-
üîé L‚Äôartiste repr√©sente ici le duc en pied, en tenue d‚Äôofficier, la main gauche pos√©e sur la garde de l‚Äô√©p√©e, la main droite tenant une paire de gants blancs, le bicorne pos√© sur le bras.
-
üé® A l‚Äôoccasion de la r√©ouverture du @museeingres √† Montauban, la ville natale d‚ÄôIngres, le mus√©e du Louvre a pr√™t√© plusieurs peintures, dont cette repr√©sentation n√©o-classique du duc Ferdinand d‚ÄôOrl√©ans.
- - - -
üåè Do you recognize this portrait?
-
üëë As the eldest son of the French king Louis-Philippe I and promised to succeed him, the Duke of Orl√©ans was a very popular figure. Friend of ‚Ä™the Romantics‚Ä¨, he was also a friend of the French painter ‚Ä™Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres‚Ä¨, who painted this portrait in 1842, two months before the early death of the Duke in a carriage accident at only 32 years old.
-
üîé The artist depicts the duke in a full-length portrait, wearing an officer's uniform, his left hand on the sword guard, his right hand holding a pair of white gloves, a ‚Äúbicorne‚Äù hat on his arm.
-
üé® On the occasion of the opening of the mus√©e Ingres Bourdelle in Montauban, home town of Ingres, the Louvre lent several paintings, including this neo-classic portrait of the Duke Ferdinand d'Orl√©ans.

üì∑ ¬© 2005 Mus√©e du Louvre / Harry Br√©jat

üá´üá∑ E x p o s i t i o n ‚Äì SOULAGES AU LOUVRE ‚óº
-
‚ú® L‚Äôexposition #SoulagesAuLouvre a ouvert ses portes aujourd‚Äôhui ! A l‚Äôaube de son centi√®me anniversaire, le "peintre du noir et de la lumi√®re" est mis √† l‚Äôhonneur dans le prestigieux Salon Carr√© qui abritait jadis le Salon des Acad√©mies.
-
üëâ Cette exposition rend compte du parcours chronologique de l‚Äô≈ìuvre de 1946 √† aujourd‚Äôhui, en repr√©sentant par un choix resserr√© les huit d√©cennies pendant lesquelles Soulages a d√©velopp√© ses recherches. Ne n√©gligeant aucune p√©riode et mettant l‚Äôaccent sur les polyptyques outrenoir, l‚Äôexposition permettra √©galement de d√©couvrir de tr√®s grandes peintures r√©alis√©es ces derniers mois, signe de la vitalit√© remarquable de ce peintre qui poursuit ses recherches sans discontinuer. Apr√®s Chagall et Picasso, Soulages est le troisi√®me artiste √† entrer au Louvre de son vivant.
-
üìçDu 11 d√©cembre 2019 au 9 mars 2020.
- - -
üåç E x h i b i t i o n ‚Äì SOULAGES AT THE LOUVRE ‚óº
-
‚ú® The exhibition #SoulagesAuLouvre opened today! At the dawn of its 100 years, the ‚Äúpainter of black and light‚Äù is celebrated in the prestigious Salon Carr√©, which is located between the Galerie d‚ÄôApollon and the Grande Galerie and used to house the Paris Salon.
-
üëâ This exhibition sets out to trace the chronological development of Soulages‚Äôs work from 1946 to the present day, through a small selection of pieces created over eight decades. The exhibition covers every period, with a focus on the outrenoir polyptychs. It also presents a number of very large paintings executed in recent months, demonstrating the remarkable vitality of Soulages, who has never stopped working. After Chagall and Picasso, Soulages is the third artist to enter the Louvre during his lifetime.
-
üìç From December 11, 2019 to March 9, 2020.
-

üá´üá∑ Le mardi c‚Äôest #JourDeFermeture ! üëÄ

üîé Dans cette cour se trouve la mosa√Øque des Saisons. Datant du IVe si√®cle ap. J.-C., elle a √©t√© fra√Æchement restaur√©e par l‚Äôatelier de restauration du mus√©e Gallo-Romain de Saint-Romain-en-Gal. Retrouv√©e dans un faubourg d‚ÄôAntioche dans les ann√©es 1930, cette mosa√Øque ornait probablement une vaste pi√®ce d‚Äôune maison et comportait un bassin octogonal en son centre.
-
üåø La mosa√Øque des Saisons tire son nom de la repr√©sentation des quatre saisons sous les traits de figures f√©minines ail√©es. On retrouve √©galement des sc√®nes de chasse et des sc√®nes bucoliques, avec la pr√©sence de divers oiseaux. La restauration des tesselles, en marbre, calcaire et p√¢te de verre, a permis de r√©v√©ler la richesse chromatique de ce pavement ainsi que la grande finesse de sa r√©alisation.
-
üëâ Cette restauration a b√©n√©fici√© du soutien de la Fondation A. G. Leventis.

üìçA d√©couvrir d√®s demain en salle 419, aile Denon !

üåç Tuesday is #ClosingDay! üëÄ
The Sphinx yard is getting ready to welcome you tomorrow, after one year of closure to the public.
-
üîé In this yard is the Seasons mosaic. Dating from the 4th century AD, it has been freshly restored by the restoration workshop of the mus√©e Gallo-Romain of Saint-Romain-en-Gal. Found in Antioch in the 1930s, this mosaic probably adorned a large room in a house and had an octagonal fountain in its centre.
-
üåø The Seasons mosaic takes its name from the representation of the four seasons as winged female figures. There are also hunting scenes and bucolic scenes, with the presence of various birds. The restoration of the tesserae, in marble, limestone and glass paste, revealed the chromatic richness of this pavement as well as the great finesse of its construction.
-
üëâ This restauration was supported by the A. G. Leventis Foundation.
-
üìçTo be discovered starting tomorrow in room 419, Denon wing!

üá´üá∑ Nous vous souhaitons une¬†#BonneSemaine¬†avec ¬´¬†La Vierge de l‚ÄôAnnonciation¬†¬ª de Pompeo Batoni¬†!
-
üé® Repr√©sent√©e en buste, la t√™te de la Vierge est en partie couverte d‚Äôun voile l√©ger. Ce voile dor√© contraste avec le ch√¢le bleu clair pos√© sur ses √©paules, √©quilibrant les couleurs chaudes et les couleurs froides de la composition. Elle est tourn√©e presque de profil, √† droite. La douceur de la lumi√®re √©voque les ≈ìuvres religieuses de Guido Reni (1575-1642).

üë®üèª‚Äçüé® Les petits tableaux de Batoni ont parfois √©t√© attribu√©s √† Carlo Maratta (1625-1713), dont les images de d√©votion constituent une source d‚Äôinspiration probable. A mi-chemin entre le classicisme romain du XVIIe si√®cle et le n√©o-classicisme naissant, l‚Äôart de Batoni constitue une √©tape essentielle dans l‚Äôhistoire de la peinture europ√©enne du XVIIIe si√®cle.

üåé We wish you a #GoodWeek¬†with ‚Äò‚ÄôLa Vierge de l‚ÄôAnnonciation‚Äò‚Äô by Pompeo Batoni!
-
üé® In this head-and-shoulder portrait, the Vierge‚Äôs head is partly covered by a light veil. This golden veil contrasts with the light blue shawl on her shoulders, balancing the warm and cold colours of the composition. She is almost in profile, facing to the right. The softness of the light evokes the religious artworks of Guido Reni (1575-1642).
-
üë®üèª‚Äçüé® The small paintings of Batoni were sometimes attributed to Carlo Maratta (1625-1713), whose devotion images are a plausible inspiration. Halfway between roman classicism of the 17th century and emerging neoclassicism, Batoni‚Äôs art constitutes a main step in the history of European painting of the 18th century.

üìçDenon wing, 1st floor, room 718.

üîé A travers ses nombreux portraits, Ingres montre de mani√®re pr√©cise la mode et ses transformations entre le Premier et le Second Empire. Il repr√©sente ici Madame Marcotte, √©pouse d‚Äôun fonctionnaire du Tr√©sor, qui a 23 ans lorsqu‚Äôelle pose pour le peintre.

üëÄ Surmont√© d‚Äôune coiffure ¬´ en coques ¬ª, le visage de la jeune femme semble exprimer l‚Äôennui. Sa robe en revanche pr√©sente de nombreux d√©tails luxueux ! üåé It‚Äôs #FashionFriday at the Louvre! Today, let‚Äôs focus on a portrait by Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres depicting Madame Marcotte de Sainte Marie. ‚§µÔ∏è

üá´üá∑ Mercredi, c‚Äôest #HistoireDuLouvre !

üîé Cette salle a √©t√© construite par Pierre Lescot entre 1546 et 1549 √† la demande de Fran√ßois 1er, dans un style Renaissance. Les quatre statues de femmes sculpt√©es par Jean Goujon en 1550 lui ont donn√© son nom. Ces Caryatides font office de colonnes qui soutiennent la tribune des musiciens, situ√©e dans la partie nord de la salle.

üåé Wednesday it‚Äôs #LouvreHistory!
Have you ever been in the salle des Caryatides?
-
üîé This room was built by Pierre Lescot between 1546 and 1549, at the request of Fran√ßois 1er, in a Renaissance style. The four women statues, sculpted by Jean Goujon in 1550, gave it its name. These Caryatids act as columns that support the musicians‚Äô gallery, situated in the north part of the room.

üëÄ The south part serving as royal court, the salle des Caryatides contains justice and party areas at the same time. To delineate them, the architect created a separation called ¬´ serlienne ¬ª. The two functions that she houses turns it into a central area in the palace‚Äôs life.

‚úçÔ∏è The drawing you can see by swiping left was made by Charles Fr√©d√©ric Nepveu and depicts a view of the Caryatides‚Äô room, probably between 1815 and 1830. We can see a family, walking down the Louvre and contemplating the Vase Borgh√®se, a masterpiece of the Hellenistic art.

üé® It is the Three Graces by Lucas Cranach. Painted on a small wood panel in 1531, this artwork depicts three female nudes with exquisite finesse. A theme that dates back to Antiquity, the Three Graces often personify mirth, abundance and splendor.
